changed.from: The priority of the module. 9 is highest and 0 is lowest. Modules with the same priority can be assumed to be called in random order

str.o:
The priority of the module.

Modules with the same priority can be assumed to be called in random order.
str.t: Die Priorität des Moduls. 9 ist die Höchste, 0 die Niedrigste. Module mit gleicher Priorität werden in zufälliger Reihenfolge aufgerufen.

changed.from: Default site

str.o: If true, this site will be selected in preference of other sites when virtual hosting is used and no host header is supplied, or the supplied host header does not match the address of any of the other servers.
str.t: Bei Aktivierung wird diese Website verwendet, falls virtuelle Websites existieren, aber der Client per HTTP-Protokoll keine oder keine gültige Website auswählt (kein "host header").

str.o: This text will be visible in the administration interface, it can be quite useful to use as a memory helper.
str.t: Dieser Kommentar wird im Konfigurations-Menü angezeigt und dient der Dokumentation.

str.o: This is the name that will be used in the administration interface. If this is left empty, the actual name of the site will be used.
str.t: Dieser ausführliche Name wird im Konfigurations-Menü für den virtuellen Server benutzt. Wird dieses Feld leer gelassen, wird der interne kurze Name des virtuellen Servers benutzt.

changed.from:
What format to use for logging. The syntax is: 
response-code or *: Log format for that response code

Log format is normal characters, or one or more of the variables below:

\n \t \r        -- As in C, newline, tab and linefeed
$char(int)      -- Insert the (1 byte) character specified by the integer.
$wchar(int)     -- Insert the (2 byte) word specified by the integer.
$int(int)       -- Insert the (4 byte) word specified by the integer.
$^              -- Supress newline at the end of the logentry
$host           -- The remote host name, or ip number.
$vhost          -- The Host request-header sent by the client, or - if none
$ip_number      -- The remote ip number.
$bin-ip_number  -- The remote host id as a binary integer number.
$cern_date      -- Cern Common Log file format date.
$bin-date       -- Time, but as an 32 bit integer in network byteorder
$method         -- Request method
$resource       -- Resource identifier
$full_resource  -- Full requested resource, including any query fields
$protocol       -- The protocol used (normally HTTP/1.0)
$response       -- The response code sent
$bin-response   -- The response code sent as a binary short number
$length         -- The length of the data section of the reply
$bin-length     -- Same, but as an 32 bit integer in network byteorder
$request-time   -- The time the request took (seconds)
$referer        -- The header 'referer' from the request, or '-'.
$user_agent     -- The header 'User-Agent' from the request, or '-'.
$user_agent_raw -- Same, but spaces in the name are not encoded to %20.
$user           -- the name of the auth user used, if any
$user_id        -- A unique user ID, if cookies are supported,
                   by the client, otherwise '0'
$cache-status   -- A comma separated list of words (containing no
                   whitespace) that describes which cache(s) the page
                   was delivered from:
                   protcache -- The low-level cache in the HTTP
                                protocol module.
                   xsltcache -- The XSLT cache.
                   pcoderam  -- RXML parse tree RAM cache.
                   pcodedisk -- RXML parse tree persistent cache.
                   cachetag  -- No RXML <cache> tag misses.
                   nocache   -- No hit in any known cache.

str.o:
Describes the format to use for access logging. The log file can also receive messages for various internal activities. Empty lines and lines beginning with '#' are ignored. Other lines describes how to log either an access or an internal event.

A line to format an access logging message is one of:

<response code>: <log format>
*: <log format>

<response code> is an HTTP status code. The corresponding <log format> is used for all responses matching that code. It's described in more detail below. If '*' is used instead of a response code then that line matches all responses that aren't matched by any specific response code line.

A line to format an event logging message is one of:

<facility>/<action>: <log format>
<facility>/*: <log format>
*/*: <log format>

<facility> matches an identifier for the Roxen module or subsystem that the event comes from. Facility identifiers always starts with a character in [a-zA-Z0-9] and contains only characters in [-_.#a-zA-Z0-9]. If '*' is used instead of <facility> then that line matches all facilities that aren't matched by any other line.

<action> matches an identifier for a specific kind of event logged by a facility. An action identifier contains only characters in [-_.#a-zA-Z0-9]. '*' may be used instead of an <action> to match all events logged by a facility that aren't matched by any other line.

<log format> consists of literal characters and the special specifiers described below. All specifiers are not applicable for all kinds of messages. If an unknown or inapplicable specifier is encountered it typically expands to '-', but in some cases it expands to a dummy value that is syntactically compatible with what it usually expands to.

For compatibility, underscores ('_') may be used wherever hyphens ('-') occur in the specifier names.

Format specifiers for both access and event logging

\n \t \r Insert a newline, tab or linefeed character, respectively.
$char(int) Insert the (1 byte) character specified by the integer. E.g. '$char(36)' inserts a literal '$' character.
$wchar(int) Insert the specified integer using 2 bytes in network byte order. Specify a negative integer to get the opposite (i.e. big endian) order.
$int(int) Insert the specified integer using 4 bytes in network byte order. Specify a negative integer to get the opposite (i.e. big endian) order.
$^ Suppress newline at the end of the logentry.
$date Local date formatted like '2001-01-17'.
$time Local time formatted like '13:00:00'.
$cern-date Local date and time in CERN Common Log file format, i.e. like '17/Jan/2001:13:00:00 +0200'.
$utc-date UTC date formatted like '2001-01-17'.
$utc-time UTC time formatted like '13:00:00'.
$bin-date Unix time as a 32 bit integer in network byte order.
$resource Resource identifier. For events, this is either a path to a file (if it begins with '/') or some other kind of resource identifier (otherwise). It is '-' for events that don't act on any specific resource.
$server-uptime Server uptime in seconds.
$server-cputime Server cpu (user+system) time in milliseconds.
$server-usertime Server cpu user time in milliseconds.
$server-systime Server cpu system time in milliseconds.

Format specifiers for access logging

$host The remote host name, or ip number.
$vhost The Host request-header sent by the client, or '-' if none.
$ip-number The remote ip number.
$bin-ip-number The remote host ip as a binary integer number.
$link-layer The link layer protocol used for the request if known.
$cipher-suite The TLS/SSL cipher suite used for the request if applicable.
$forwarded The Forwarded (RFC 7239) headers or X-Forwarded-* headers for the request, or '-' if none were provided.
$xff The remote host name/ip taken from the X-Forwarded-For header, or '-' if none were provided. If multiple headers or multiple values are given the first value is logged; this should correspond to the originating computer.
$method Request method.
$full-resource Full requested resource, including any query fields.
$protocol The protocol used (normally HTTP/1.1).
$scheme The URL scheme (e.g. http or https) derived from the port handler module.
$response The response code sent.
$bin-response The response code sent as a binary short number.
$length The length of the data section of the reply.
$bin-length Same, but as a 32 bit integer in network byte order.
$queue-length Number of jobs waiting to be processed by the handler threads at the time this request was added to the queue.
$queue-time Time in seconds that the request spent in the internal handler queue, waiting to be processed by a handler thread.
$handle-time Time in seconds spent processing the request in a handler thread. This measures the server processing time, excluding I/O and time spent in the handler queue. Note however that this measures real time, not virtual process time. I.e. if there are other handler threads or processes using the CPU then this might not accurately show the time that the Roxen server spent on the request. Also note that if a handler thread has to wait for responses from other servers then that wait time is included in this measurement.
$handle-cputime CPU time in seconds spent processing the request in a handler thread. Similar to $handle-time, but only includes the actual CPU time spent on this request only. Time spent waiting for responses from external server is not included here. Note that this time might have very low accuracy on some platforms. There are also platforms where this measurement isn't available at all, and in that case this fields expands to "-".
$request-time Time in seconds that the whole request took on the server side, including I/O time for receiving the request and sending the response. Note that this measures real time - see $handle-time for further discussion.
$etag The entity tag (aka ETag) header of the result.
$referrer The header 'referer' from the request, or '-'.
$referer Same as $referrer. Common misspelling kept for compatibility.
$user-agent The header 'User-Agent' from the request, or '-'.
$user-agent-raw Same, but spaces in the name are not encoded to %20.
$user The name of the user, if any is given using the HTTP basic authentication method.
$user-id A unique user ID, if cookies are supported, by the client, otherwise '0'.
$content-type Resource MIME type.
$cookies All cookies sent by the browser, separated by ';'.
$set-cookies All cookies set by the response, separated by ';'.
$cache-status A comma separated list of words (containing no whitespace) that describes how the request got handled by various caches:
protcache The page is served from the HTTP protocol cache.
protstore The page is stored in the HTTP protocol cache.
stale There is a stale entry in the HTTP protocol cache. A refresh is underway in the background and the stale entry is sent in the meantime to avoid a long response time and server congestion.
refresh This is the finishing of the background refresh request for the entry in the HTTP protocol cache.
icachedraw A server-generated image had to be rendered from scratch.
icacheram A server-generated image was found in the RAM cache.
icachedisk A server-generated image was found in the disk cache (i.e. in the server's MySQL database).
pcoderam A hit in the RXML p-code RAM cache.
pcodedisk A hit in the RXML p-code persistent cache.
pcodestore P-code is added to or updated in the persistent cache.
pcodestorefailed An attempt to add or update p-code in the persistent cache failed (e.g. due to a race with another request).
cachetag RXML was evaluated without any cache miss in any RXML <cache> tag. The <nocache> tag does not count as a miss.
xsltcache There is a hit XSLT cache.
nocache No hit in any known cache, and not added to the HTTP protocol cache.
$eval-status A comma separated list of words (containing no whitespace) that describes how the page has been evaluated:
bad-charset Detected invalid charset in declared content-type.
xslt XSL transform.
rxmlsrc RXML evaluated from source.
rxmlpcode RXML evaluated from compiled p-code.
$protcache-cost The lookup depth in the HTTP protocol module low-level cache.

Event logging

The known event logging facilities and modules are described below.

Facility: roxen

This is logging for systems in the Roxen WebServer core. For logging that is not related to any specific configuration, the configuration for the Administration Interface is used.

The known events are:

ram-cache-gc Logged after the RAM cache GC has run. $handle-time and $handle-cputime are set to the time the GC took (see descriptions above for details).
ram-cache-rebase Logged when the RAM cache has performed a rebias of the priority queue values. Is a problem only if it starts to happen too often.
Facility: sbfs

A SiteBuilder file system.

The actions commit, purge, mkdir, set-dir-md, and rmdir are logged for file system changes except those in edit areas.

The action crawl-file is logged for files that are crawled by the persistent cache crawler.

The actions file-change and dir-change-flat are logged when external file and directory changes are detected (and this feature is enabled).

These extra format specifiers are defined where applicable:

$ac-userid The ID number of the AC identity whose edit area was used. Zero for the common view area.
$workarea The unique tag for the work area. Empty for the main work area.
$commit-type The type of file commit, one of create, edit, delete, and undelete.
$revision The committed revision number, a dotted decimal.
$comment The commit message.
$request-time This is set for the action crawl-file. It's similar to $request-time for normal requests, except that it measures the whole time it took for the persistent cache crawler to process the page. That includes all crawled variants and the saving of the entry to the database.
str.t:
Welches Format für die Protokolldateien benutzt werden soll. 
Antwort-Code oder *: Loggingformat für diesen Antwort-Code (z.B 404)

Das Loggingformat ist normaler Text, in den folgende
Variabeln eingesetzt werden können.

\\n \\t \\r    -- Newline, Tab oder Linefeed-Zeichen (wie in C)
$char(int)     -- Fügt das 8Bit-Zeichen ein, das dem Integerwert entspricht.
$wchar(int)    -- Fügt das 16Bit-Zeichen ein, das dem Integerwert entspricht.
$int(int)      -- Fügt das 32Bit-Word ein, das dem Integerwert entspricht.
$^             -- Unterdrückt das Newline-Zeichen am Ende des Eintrages.
$host          -- Hostname oder IP-Adresse des Webbrowsers.
$vhost         -- Der Host Request-Header vom Webbrowser, oder -
$ip_number     -- IP-Adresse des Webbrowsers.
$bin-ip_number -- IP-Adresse des Webbrowsers in 32Bit-Dezimaldarstellung.
$cern_date     -- Uhrzeit und Datum im CERN-Format.
$bin-date      -- Zeit als 32Bit-Integer-Darstellung (Sekunden seit 1.1.1970).
$method        -- Anfrage-Methode (GET, POST, usw.)
$resource      -- Angeforderte Datei.
$protocol      -- Verwendetes Protokoll (normalerweise HTTP/1.0 oder HTTP/1.1)
$response      -- Der verschichte Antwort-Code
$bin-response  -- Der verschickte Antwort-Code in 32Bit-Dezimaldarstellung
$length        -- Die Größe der verschickten Daten
$bin-length    -- Die Größe der verschickten Daten in 32Bit-Dezimaldarstellung
$request-time  -- Verstrichene Zeit in Sekunden, die die Anfrage benötigt hat
$referer       -- Die 'referer'-Information aus der Anfrage, oder '-'
$user_agent    -- Die 'user-agent'-Information aus der Anfrage, oder '-'
$user          -- Der Name des angemeldeten Benutzers, sofern vorhanden
$user_id       -- Die eindeutige Benutzerkennung, sofern Cookies vom
                  Browser unterstützt wurden, ansonsten '0'.
$cache-status  -- Eine Komma-separierte Liste von Worten (ohne
                  Leerzeichen), die die Caches ausgeben, aus der
                  die Seite ausgeliefert wurde:
                  protcache -- Der low-level-Cache des HTTP-Moduls.
                  xsltcache -- Der XSLT-Cache.
                  pcoderam  -- RXML Parse-Baum, RAM-Cache.
                  pcodedisk -- RXML Parse-Baum, persistenter Cache.
                  cachetag  -- Kein RXML <cache> Tag fehlt.
                  nocache   -- Kein Cache-Treffer.

changed.from:
The log file. 
%y    Year  (e.g. '1997')
%m    Month (e.g. '08')
%d    Date  (e.g. '10' for the tenth)
%h    Hour  (e.g. '00')
%H    Hostname

str.o:
The log file. A file name. Some substitutions will be done:
%y    Year  (e.g. '1997')
%m    Month (e.g. '08')
%d    Date  (e.g. '10' for the tenth)
%h    Hour  (e.g. '00')
%H    Hostname
str.t:
Der Name der Protokolldatei. Folgende Ersetzungen werden vorgenommen: 
%y    Jahr     (z.B. '1997')
%m    Monat    (z.B. '08')
%d    Tag      (z.B. '10' für den 10. des Monats)
%h    Stunden  (z.B. '00')

str.o: Don't log requests from hosts with an IP number which matches any of the patterns in this list. This also affects the access counter log.
str.t: Keine Protokollierung für Host, deren IP-Adresse auf Muster in dieser Liste passt. Dies hat auch Einfluss auf den Access-Counter.

str.o: The domain name of the server. The domain name is used to generate default URLs, and to generate email addresses.
str.t: Der Domänenname des Servers. Dieser Name wird für die Generierung der Standard-URLs und E-Mail-Adressen verwendet.

str.o:
This is the main server URL, where your start page is located. This setting is for instance used as fallback to generate absolute URLs to the server, but in most circumstances the URLs sent by the clients are used. A URL is deduced from the first entry in 'URLs' if this is left blank.

Note that setting this doesn't make the server accessible; you must also set 'URLs'.
str.t: Dies ist die URL des primären Servers, auf dem die Startseite abgelegt ist. Bitte konfigurieren Sie auch die Variable 'URLs'. Diese Einstellung ist z.B. als Absicherung, um absolute URLs zu erzeugen. Meistens werden aber die URLs, die der Browser schickt, benutzt. Eine URL wird abgeleitet vom ersten Eintrag in 'URLs', wenn diese Einstellung leer bleibt.

str.o: Some modules may want to create links to internal resources. This setting configures an internally handled location that can be used for such purposes. Simply select a location that you are not likely to use for regular resources.
str.t: Einige Module erzeugen Links auf interne Ressourcen. Diese Einstellung bestimmt eine intern verwendete Position im virtuellen Dateisystem für solche Zwecke. Es sollte ein Wert eingetragen werden, der auch zukünftig nicht durch andere Ressourcen benutzt wird.

str.o:
If set, per-server bandwidth throttling will be enabled. It will allow you to limit the total available bandwidth for this site.
Bandwidth is assigned using a Token Bucket. The principle under which it works is: for each byte we send we use a token. Tokens are added to a repository at a constant rate. When there's not enough, we can't transmit. When there's too many, they "spill" and are lost.
str.t: Bei Aktivierung wird pro Server eine Drosselung der Bandbreite vorgenommen. Dadurch kann man die zur Verfügung stehende Bandbreite für diesen virtuellen Server begrenzen.

str.o: This is the average bandwidth available to this site in bytes/sec (the bucket "fill rate").
str.t: Dies ist die durchschnittliche Bandbreite in Byte/Sekunde, die für diesen virtuellen Server zur Verfügung steht.

str.o:
This is the maximum depth of the bucket. After a long enough period of inactivity, a request will get this many unthrottled bytes of data, before throttling kicks back in.
Set equal to the Fill Rate in order not to allow any data bursts. This value determines the length of the time over which the bandwidth is averaged.

When the bandwidth availability is below this value, connections will be delayed rather than granted minimal amounts of bandwidth. The purpose is to avoid sending too small packets (which would increase the IP overhead).
str.t: Sinkt die Bandbreite aufgrund zu vieler Verbindungen unter diesen Wert, dann werden neue Verbindungen herausgezögert. So sollen zu kleine IP-Pakete verhindert werden, bei denen die Nutzlast unter den Faktor 1 sinkt (mehr Verwaltungsinformation als Nutzlast).

str.o: This is the maximum number of bytes assigned in a single request to a connection. Keeping this number low will share bandwidth more evenly among the pending connections, but keeping it too low will increase IP overhead and (marginally) CPU usage. You'll want to set it just a tiny bit lower than any integer multiple of your network's MTU (typically 1500 for ethernet).
str.t: Maximale Anzahl von Bytes, die einer. Niedrige Werte sorgen für eine gleichmässige Zuteilung von Bandbreite zu den Verbindungen, senken aber die Nutzlast und erhöhen marginal die CPU-Belastung. Der empfohlene Wert ist XXX

str.o: If set, per-request bandwidth throttling will be enabled.
str.t: Bei Aktivierung wird eine Bandbreiten-Drosselung pro Zugriff eingeschaltet.

str.o: The maximum bandwidth each connection (in bytes/sec) can use is determined combining a number of modules. But doing so can lead to too small or even negative bandwidths for particularly unlucky requests. This variable guarantees a minimum bandwidth for each request.
The average bandwidth available for each request will be determined by the modules combination. The bucket depth will be determined multiplying the rate by this factor.
What to return when there is no resource or file available at a certain location.
str.t: Dieser Text wird angezeigt, wenn eine nicht verfügbare Datei aufgerufen wird. '$File' wird ersetzt durch den Dateinamen, '$Me' durch die Server-URL.

str.o: The text shown to the user on connect.
str.t: Dieser Text wird dem Anwender zu Beginn der Verbindung angezeigt.

str.o: The maximum number of times a user can connect at once. 0 means unlimited.
str.t: Die maximale Anzahl von gleichzeitigen Verbindung desselben Kontos. 0 bedeutet unbegrenzt.

changed.from: If yes, non-anonymous users can connect.

str.o: If yes, non-anonymous users can connect. Note that for password authentication to be performed you will need to have the "Authentication: Password" module in your site.
str.t: Bei Aktivierung können Anwender mit anderen Konten als dem anonymen eine Verbindung herstellen.
Erlaube Anmeldung mit falschem Kennwort oder Konto

str.o: If yes, users can connect with the wrong password and/or username. This is useful since things like .htaccess files can later on authenticate the user.
str.t: Bei Aktivierung können Anwender trotz fehlgeschlagener Anmeldung eine Verbindung herstellen. Diese Einstellung ist nützlich in Fällen, bei denen Anwender im Verlaufe der Sitzung sowieso eine Anmeldung

str.o: If yes, anonymous users are allowed to connect.
str.t: Bei Aktivierung werden anonyme FTP-Verbindungen zugelassen.

str.o: If this string is set to anything but the empty string, it should specify a file containing a list of valid shells. Users with shells that are not in this list will not be allowed to log in.
str.t: Unter Unix ist jedem Benutzer-Konto ist eine Shell zugewiesen und diese Shell muss in der angegebenen Datei verzeichnet sein, damit sich der Anwender anmelden kann.. Falls das Feld leer gelassen wird, ist die Funktion inaktiv.

str.o: Show 'Internal server error' messages to the user. This is very useful if you are debugging your own modules or writing Pike scripts.
str.t: Dem Anwender interne Server-Fehler zeigen? Diese Funktion ist bei der Entwicklung und bei der Fehlersuche in eigenen Modulen oder Pike-Scripten nützlich.

str.o: Logging: Set unique browser id cookies

changed.from: If set to Yes, all clients that accepts cookies will get a unique 'user-id-cookie', which can then be used in the log and in scripts to track individual users.

str.o: If set to Yes, all clients that accept cookies will get a unique 'user-id-cookie', which can then be used in the log and in scripts to track individual users.
str.t: Bei Aktivierung wird allen Clients, die Cookies unterstützen, ein eindeutiger Cookie 'user-id-cookie' gesetzt. Der Cookie kann in Scripten oder in der Protokolldatei zur Verfolgung einzelner Benutzer verwendet werden.

str.o: Logging: Set ID cookies only once

If set to Yes, Roxen will attempt to set unique browser ID cookies only upon receiving the first request (and again after some minutes). Thus, if the user doesn't allow the cookie to be set, she won't be bothered with multiple requests.
str.t: Bei Aktivierung wird dem Client des Besuchers nur beim ersten Kontakt ein eindeutiger User-ID-Cookie geschickt. Sollte der Anwender in seiner Browser-Voreinstellung Cookies ablehnen, dann wird mit dieser Einstellung verhindert, dass der Anwender ständig auf die Cookies hingewiesen wird.

changed.from: SSL certificate file
The SSL certificate file to use. The path is relative to %s.

str.o:
The SSL certificate file(s) to use.

This is a list of certificates, intermediate and root certificates, and corresponding private key files in any order.

If a path is relative, it will first be searched for relative to %s, and if not found there relative to %s.
str.t: Der Name der Datei mit dem SSL-Zertifikat im PEM-Format. Der Pfad ist relativ zu %s.

changed.from: The SSL key file to use. The path is relative to %s, you do not have to specify a key file, leave this field empty to use the certificate file only.

str.o: The SSL key file to use. If the path is relative, it will first be searched for relative to %s, and if not found there relative to %s. You do not have to specify a key file, leave this field empty to use the certificate file only. This field is obsolete, since the same setting can be done in SSL certificate file(s).
str.t: Der Name der Datei mit dem SSL-Schlüssel. Der Pfad ist relativ zu %s. Der Schlüssel kann auch in der obigen Zertifikats-Datei mit angegeben werden; dann muss dieses Feld leer bleiben.

str.o: Logging: Log entire file length in restored connections
str.t: Protokollierung: Vollständige Dateilänge bei wieder aufgenommenen Verbindungen

str.o:
If this toggle is enabled log entries for restored connections will log the amount of sent data plus the restoration location. Ie if a user has downloaded 100 bytes of a file already, and makes a Range request fetching the remaining 900 bytes, the log entry will log it as if the entire 1000 bytes were downloaded.

This is useful if you want to know if downloads were successful (the user has the complete file downloaded). The drawback is that bandwidth statistics on the log file will be incorrect. The statistics in Roxen will still be correct.
str.t:
Bei wieder aufgenommenen Verbindungen werden die übertragenen Daten sowie die bisher verschickten Daten verzeichnet. Wenn ein Benutzer bereits 100 Byte einer Datei geladen hat, und in einem späteren Download die fehlenden 900 Byte überträgt, werden im Logfile die gesamten 1000 Byte verzeichnet.

Dies ist nützlich, um erfolgreiche Downloads zu erkennen.

str.o: The default font to use when modules request a font.
str.t: Die voreingestellte Schriftart für die Verwendung durch Module.

str.o: This is where the fonts are located.
str.t: Pfadname des Orders mit den Schriftarten.

str.o: If set to Yes, fonts will be oversampled resulting in higher quality but more fuzz. This will require clearing of various graphics caches like the Graphic text and GButton caches to take full effect.
str.t: Schriftarten werden geglättet, um eine höhere Qualität mit weichen Kanten zu erzielen. Hierzu müssen die Grafik-Caches gelöscht werden, damit die Änderungen aktiv werden.

str.o: This is the default file path that will be prepended to the log file path in all the default modules and the site.
str.t: Alle Logdateien werden unterhalb dieses Verzeichnisses abgelegt.

str.o: If set to Yes, caching will be enabled.
Cache: Proxy Disk Cache Clean size
Minimum number of Megabytes removed when a garbage collect is done.
str.t: Wird der Cache geleert, werden mindestens soviel Megabyte entfernt.

str.o: Cache: Proxy Disk Cache Minimum available free space and inodes (in %)
str.t: Cache: Proxy Plattencache, minimaler freier Platz und Inodes (in %)

str.o: If less than this amount of disk space or inodes (in %) is left, the cache will remove a few files. This check may work half-hearted if the diskcache is spread over several filesystems.
str.t: Bei Unterschreiten dieses Wertes (in %) werden einige Dateien aus dem Cache entfernt.

str.o: How many MB may the cache grow to before a garbage collect is done?
str.t: Maximale Größe des Proxy-Caches auf der Festplatte, in MB.

str.o: Cache: Proxy Disk Cache Maximum number of files
How many cache files (inodes) may be on disk before a garbage collect is done? May be left at zero to disable this check.
str.t: Wie viele Dateien dürfen im Cache sein, bevor eine Reinigung (Garbage Collection) stattfindet. Durch Setzen auf Null wird diese Abfrage ignoriert.

str.o: Cache: Proxy Disk Cache bytes per second
str.t: Cache: Proxy Plattencache, Bytes pro Sekunde

str.o: How file size should be treated during garbage collect. Each X bytes count as a second, so that larger files will be removed first.
str.t: Wie wichtig ist die Dateigröße beim Reinigen des Caches? Jedes Byte entspricht einem gewissen Dateialter in Sekunden. Größere Dateien werden also eher entfernt.

str.o: Cache: Proxy Disk Cache Base Cache Dir
This is the base directory where cached files will reside. To avoid mishaps, 'roxen_cache/' is always appended to this variable.
str.t: In diesem Verzeichnis werden die Cache-Dateien abgelegt. Um Pannen zu vermeiden, wird 'roxen_cache/' vor diesen Wert gesetzt.

str.o: Cache: Proxy Disk Cache Number of hash directories
str.t: Cache: Proxy Plattencache, Anzahl der Hash-Verzeichnisse

str.o: This is the number of directories to hash the contents of the disk cache into. Changing this value currently invalidates the whole cache, since the cache cannot find the old files. In the future, the cache will be recalculated when this value is changed.
str.t: Dies ist die Anzahl an Verzeichnissen, auf die die Cache-Dateien verteilt werden. Das Ändern dieses Wertes macht den bisherigen Proxy-Cache ungültig.

str.o: Cache: Proxy Disk Cache Keep without Content-Length
str.t: Cache: Proxy Plattencache, Ohne Content-Length speichern

str.o: Keep files without Content-Length header information in the cache?
str.t: Sollen Dateien ohne Content-Length im Cache behalten werden?

str.o: Cache: Proxy Disk Cache Refreshes on Last-Modified
str.t: Cache: Proxy Plattencache, aktualisieren bei Last-Modified

str.o: If set, refreshes files without Expire header information when they have reached double the age they had when they got cached. This may be useful for some regularly updated docs as online newspapers.
str.t: Der Cache wird anhand der Last-Modified-Information Dateien aus dem Cache entfernen, sofern kein Expire-Header vorhanden ist. Die Dateien verbleiben im Cache, bis sie ihr Alter verdoppelt haben.

str.o: Cache: Proxy Disk Cache Last resort (in days)
How many days shall files without Expires and without Last-Modified header information be kept?
str.t: Wieviel Tage sollen Dateien ohne Expire- und Last-Modifier-Informationen im Cache verbleiben?

str.o: Cache: Proxy Disk Cache Garbage collector logfile
str.t: Cache: Proxy Plattencache, Garbage Collector Logdatei

str.o: Information about garbage collector runs, removed and refreshed files, cache and disk status goes here.
str.t: Informationen über Aktivitäten der Garbage Collection: gelöschte und aktualisierte Dateien, Cache- und Festplatten-Status werden vermerkt.

str.o:
Setting this variable to No will display the "Identify as" node where you can state what Roxen should call itself when talking to clients.
It is possible to disable this so that you can enter an identification-string that does not include the actual version of Roxen, as recommended by the HTTP/1.0 and HTTP/1.1 RFCs:

Note: Revealing the specific software version of the server may allow the server machine to become more vulnerable to attacks against software that is known to contain security holes. Server implementors are encouraged to make this field a configurable option.
str.t: Bei Nein, kann eine andere Identität als der Standardwert eingetragen werden.

str.o: Enter the name that Roxen should use when talking to clients.
str.t: Hier kann der Namen eingegeben werden, mit dem Roxen sich zu erkennen gibt, wenn ein Client Anfragen stellt.

str.o:
When Roxen is run as root, to be able to open port 80 for listening, change to this user-id and group-id when the port has been opened. If you specify a symbolic username, the default group of that user will be used. The syntax is user[:group].

A server restart is necessary for a change of this variable to take effect. Note that it also can lead to file permission errors if the Roxen process no longer can read files it previously has written. The start script attempts to fix this for the standard file locations.
str.t:
Wenn Roxen unter der root-Kennung läuft, um den Port 80 öffnen zu können, wird die User-ID und die Group-ID auf diesen Wert gesetzt, nachdem der Port geöffnet wurde. Wenn ein Benutzername (z.B. 'www') verwendet wird, wird die Standardgruppe dieses Benutzers verwendet. Die Syntax ist user[:group].

Ein Neustart des Servers ist notwendig, damit die Änderungen an dieser Variablen wirksam werden. Achten Sie darauf, dass dies zu Zugriffsproblemen bei Dateien führen kann, die der Roxen-Prozess vorher geschrieben hat, und nun nicht mehr lesen kann. Das start-Script versucht jedoch, dies für die Standard-Dateien zu beheben.

str.o: If this variable is set, Roxen will set it's uid and gid permanently. This disables the 'exec script as user' features for CGI, and also 'access files as user' in the filesystems, but it gives better security.
str.t: Wenn diese Variable gesetzt ist, wird Roxen seine UID und GID permanent auf die eingestellten Werte wechseln. Dadurch können CGI-Scripte nicht mehr unter der Kennung anderer Benutzer ausgeführt werden. Allerdings erhöht sich so die Sicherheit des Servers.

str.o: This is a list of directories where Roxen should look for modules. Can be relative paths, from the directory you started Roxen. The directories are searched in order for modules.
str.t: Eine Liste von Verzeichnissen, in denen Roxen nach Modulen suchen wird. Dies können relative Pfade sein. Die Verzeichnisse werden in der eingegeben Reihenfolge nach Modulen durchsucht.

str.o:
What do the different clients support?
The default information is normally fetched from the file server/etc/supports in your Roxen directory.
str.t: Welche unterschiedlichen Möglichkeiten werden durch die verschiedenen Webbrowser unterstützt. Die Standard-Informationen werden aus der Datei server/etc/supports im Roxen-Verzeichnis entnommen.

str.o: If Audit trail is set to Yes, all changes of uid will be logged in the Event log.
str.t: Wenn auf Ja gesetzt, werden sämtliche Wechsel von Benutzerkennungen im Ereignis-Log verzeichnet.

str.o: What method to use for the debug log, default is file, but syslog is also available. When using file, the output is really sent to stdout and stderr, but this is handled by the start script.
str.t: Welche Methode soll für das Logging benutzt werden. Standard ist Datei, aber Syslog ist ebenfalls möglich.

str.o: If set, the PID will be included in the syslog.
str.t: Soll Roxen die eigene PID ins Syslog schreiben?

str.o: If set and syslog is used, the error/debug message will be printed to the system console as well as to the system log.
str.t: Soll Roxen auf die Konsole schreiben? Fehler- und Debug-Meldungen werden sowohl auf die Konsole als auch in das Syslog geschrieben.

str.o: When using SYSLOG, which log type should be used.
str.t: Wenn Syslog verwendet wird, welcher Typ soll benutzt werden?

str.o:
When syslog is used, how much should be sent to it?
Fatal: Only messages about fatal errors
Errors: Only error or fatal messages
Warning: Warning messages as well
Debug: Debug messager as well
All: Everything
str.t:
Wenn Syslog verwendet wird, welche Informationen sollen festgehalten werden?
Fatal: Nur Mitteilungen über fatale Fehler
Errors: Nur Fehler und fatale Mitteilungen
Warning: wie oben, jedoch auch Warnungen
Debug: wie oben, jedoch auch Hinweise
All: Alles

str.o: When syslog is used, this will be the identification of the Roxen daemon. The entered value will be appended to all logs.
str.t: Wenn Syslog benutzt wird, wird dieser Wert als Identifikation in allen Logs angehängt.

str.o:
The number of simultaneous threads Roxen will use.

Please note that even if this is one, Roxen will still be able to serve multiple requests, using a select loop based system. This is quite useful if you have more than one CPU in your machine, or if you have a lot of slow NFS accesses.

Do not increase this over 20 unless you have a very good reason to do so.
str.t:
Die Anzahl an parallelen Threads, mit denen Roxen arbeiten wird.

Hinweis: Auch wenn nur ein Thread eingestellt wird, können mehrere Zugriffe gleichzeitig bearbeitet werden. Dies ist nützlich für Mehrprozessor-Systeme oder Systeme mit langsamen NFS-Zugriffen.

Setzen Sie diesen Wert nicht auf mehr als 20, ausser Sie haben einen sehr guten Grund dazu.

changed.from: Auto Restart: Enable Anti-Block-System

str.o: If set, the anti-block-system will be enabled. This will restart the server after a configurable number of minutes if it locks up. If you are running in a single threaded environment heavy calculations will also halt the server. In multi-threaded mode bugs such as eternal loops will not cause the server to reboot, since only one thread is blocked. In general there is no harm in having this option enabled.
str.t: Das Anti-Block-System wird aktiviert, dies startet den Server nach einer einstellbaren Zahl von Minuten neu, wenn ein Thread blockiert ist. Bei mehr als einem Thread wird der gesamte Server nicht komplett angehalten, sondern nur der blockierte Thread. Im allgemeinen hat diese Option keine Nachteile.

changed.from: Auto Restart: ABS Timeout

str.o: If the server is unable to accept connection for this many minutes, it will be restarted. You need to find a balance: if set too low, the server will be restarted even if it's doing legal things (like generating many images), if set too high you might get a long downtime if the server for some reason locks up.
str.t: Wenn der Server soviele Minuten nicht in der Lage ist, Anfragen zu beantworten, wird er neu gestartet. Zu beachten ist, daß bei komplexen Berechnungen es durchaus normal ist, wenn eine Anfrage eine Weile benötigt.

changed.from: Locale, used to localize all messages in Roxen. Standard means using the default locale, which varies according to the value of the 'LANG' environment variable.

str.o: Locale, used to localize all messages in Roxen. Standard means using the default locale, which varies according to the values of the 'LC_MESSAGES' and 'LANG' environment variables.
str.t: Die Sprache, in der alle Roxen-Meldungen ausgeben werden. 'standard' ist abhängig von der LANG Umgebungsvariable.

changed.from: Auto Restart: Enable Automatic Restart

str.o: If set, Roxen will automatically restart after a configurable number of days. Since Roxen uses a monolith, non-forking server model the process tends to grow in size over time. This is mainly due to heap fragmentation but may also sometimes be because of memory leaks.
str.t: Wenn gesetzt, wird Roxen automatisch nach einer bestimmten Anzahl von Tagen neugestartet. Hin und wieder wächst der Roxen-Prozess im Laufe der Zeit an. Diese Option ist in diesem Falle dann sinnvoll.

str.o: Save the variable documentation strings as comments in the configuration files. Only useful if you read or edit the config files directly.
str.t: Die Dokumentationsvariablen als Kommentare in die Konfigurationsdateien speichern. Nur nützlich, wenn die Konfigurationsdateien direkt gelesen oder bearbeitet werden.

str.o: Show all possible configuration options, not only the ones that are most often changed.
str.t: Alle möglichen Konfigurationsoptionen zeigen, nicht nur die am meisten benötigten.

str.o: Show settings and actions that are not normaly useful for non-developer users. If you develop your own Roxen modules, this option is for you.
str.t: Zeige Einstellungen und Aktionen, die normalerweise nicht nützlich sind für nicht-Entwickler. Wenn Sie eigene Roxen-Module entwickeln, ist diese Option richtig für Sie.

changed.from: Reload module list

str.o: Select one or several modules to add.
str.t: Wählen Sie ein oder mehrere Module aus.

str.o: The size of the data cache used to speed up requests for commonly requested files, in KBytes
str.t: Die Größe des Daten-Caches, die zur Beschleunigung von Anfragen auf häufig abgerufene Dateien benutzt wird. In KBytes

changed.from: The maximum size of a file that is to be considered for the cache

str.o: The maximum size of a file that is to be considered for the cache, in KBytes.
str.t: Die maximale Dateigröße, die für den Cache verwendet werden soll

str.o: If true, the list of sites will be presented in a compact format suitable for servers with many sites.
str.t: Wenn ja, die Site-Liste wird in einem kompakten Format angezeigt, brauchbar für Server mit vielen Sites.

changed.from: really compact

str.o: Module event log for '%s' cleared by %s (%s) from %s
This port was requested, but binding it failed.
str.t: Dieser Port wurde verlangt, aber Bindung schlug fehl.

str.o: The charset to use when rendering configuration interface pages.
str.t: Der Zeichensatz, der für das Konifgurations-Interface benutzt wird.

str.o: Are you sure you want to disable the site %s?
str.t: Sind Sie sicher, dass sie die Site %s deaktivieren wollen?

str.o: The default order variables are sorted in

changed.from: as defined
alphabetical, changed first
as defined, changed first

str.o: How to highlight variables that does not have their default value
str.t: Wie sollen die Variablen hervorgehoben werden, die nicht ihren Standardwert haben

str.o: If true, tasks are grouped acording to type, otherwise all tasks will be listed on one page
str.t: Wenn ja, werden Aufgaben nach Typ in Gruppen zusammengefasst, ansonsten werden alle Aufgaben auf einer Seite aufgelistet

changed.from:
The modules security level is used to determine if a request should be handled by the module.

Security level vs Trust level

Each module has a configurable security level. Each request has an assigned trust level. Higher trust levels grants access to modules with higher security levels.

Definitions

  • A requests initial Trust level is infinitely high.
  • A request will only be handled by a module if its trust level is higher or equal to the security level of the module.
  • Each time the request is handled by a module the trust level of the module will be set to the lower of its trust level and the modules security level, unless the security level of the module is 0, which is a special case and means that no change should be made.

Example

Modules:
  • User filesystem, security level 1
  • Filesystem module, security level 3
  • CGI module, security level 2

A request handled by

str.o:
The modules security level is used to determine if a request should be handled by the module.

Security level vs Trust level

Each module has a configurable security level. Each request has an assigned trust level. Higher trust levels grants access to modules with higher security levels.

Definitions

  • A requests initial trust level is infinitely high.
  • A request will only be handled by a module if its trust level is higher or equal to the security level of the module.
  • Each time the request is handled by a module the trust level of the request will be set to the lower of its trust level and the modules security level, unless the security level of the module is 0, which is a special case and means that no change should be made.

Example

Modules:
  • User filesystem, security level 1
  • Filesystem module, security level 3
  • CGI module, security level 2

A request handled by "User filesystem" is assigned a trust level of one after the security level of that module. That request can then not be handled by the "CGI module" since that module has a higher security level than the requests trust level.

On the other hand, a request handled by the the "Filesystem module" could later be handled by the "CGI module".
str.t:
Das Sicherheitslevel-Modul bestimmt, welches Modul eine Anfrage behandelt.

Sicherheit contra Vertrauen

Jedes Modul hat einen einstellbaren Sicherheitslevel. Jede Anfrage besitzt einen Vertrauenspegel. Höhere Vertrauenspegel gewähren Zugriffe auf Module mit höhrerem Sicherheitslevel.

Definitionen

  • Der Vertrauenspegel einer Anfrage ist zu Beginn unendlich hoch.
  • Eine Anfrage wird durch ein Modul nur dann behandelt, wenn sein Vertrauenspegel höher oder gleich dem Sicherheitslevel des Moduls ist.
  • Bei jeder Behandlung eines Zugriffs durch ein Modul wird der Vertrauenspegel des Moduls auf den kleineren Wert von Vertrauenspegel und dem Sicherheitslevel des Moduls gesetzt, ausser der Sicherheitslevel des Moduls ist 0, was bedeutet, das keine Änderung vorgenommen werden soll.

Beispiele

Module:
  • User filesystem, Sicherheitslevel 1
  • Filesystem module, Sicherheitslevel 3
  • CGI module, Sicherheitslevel 2

Einer Anfrage, die durch das "User filesystem" behandelt wird, wird ein Vertrauenspegel nach einem der Sicherheitslevel deses Moduls zugewiesen. Diese Anfrage kann dann nicht mehr durch das "CGI-Modul" behandelt werden, da dieses Modul einen höhreren Sicherheitslevel als der Vertrauenspegel der Anfrage hat.

Ansonsten kann die Anfrage durch das "Dateisystem-Modul" und später durch das "CGI-Modul" behandelt werden.

str.o:
If no file match a given resource all directories above the wanted file is searched for one of the files in this list.

As an example, if the file /foo/bar/not_there.html is wanted, and this list contains the default value of 404.inc, these files will be searched for, in this order:

The inclusion file can access the form variables form.orig-file and form.orig-url to identify the original page that was requested.

Wird zum Beispiel die Datei /foo/bar/nicht_vorhanden.html angefordert und in dieser Liste steht der Standardwert 404.inc, wird in folgender Reihenfolge gesucht:


/foo/bar/404.inc, /foo/404.inc und /404.inc.

changed.from: The name of the configuration must contain characters other than space and tab, it should not end with ~, and it must not be 'CVS', 'Global Variables' or 'global variables', nor the name of an existing configuration, and the character '/' cannot be used. This name will show up in the sites menu, a lowercased, filesystem-friendly version will become the virtual server's configuration file name as well as the name of its log file directory.

str.o: The name of the configuration must contain characters other than space and tab, it must not contain '?', '!', '/', '\', '~', '"', ''', '`', '#', '$', '%', '&', '=', ';', ':', '_', '<', '>', '|', '*', and it must not be 'CVS', 'Global Variables' or 'global variables', nor the name of an existing configuration. This name will show up in the sites menu, a lowercased, filesystem-friendly version will become the virtual server's configuration file name as well as the name of its log file directory.
str.t: Der Name der Konfiguration darf keine Leerzeichen oder Tabs enthalten, es darf nicht mit ~ enden, und es darf nicht 'CVS', 'Global Variables' oder 'global variables' sein, auch nicht der Name einer bestehenden Konfiguration. Das Zeichen '/' darf ebenfalls nicht benutzt werden. Der Name erscheint im Site-Menu, ein lowercase dateisystemfreundlicher Name wird der Dateiname der Konfigurationsdatei und des Protokollverzeichnisses.

str.o: The server secret is a string used in some cryptographic functions, such as calculating unique, non-guessable session id's. Change this value into something that is hard to guess, unless you are satisfied with what your computers random generator has produced.
str.t: Das Server-Geheimnis ist eine Zeichenkette, die in einigen kryptographischen Funktionen verwendet wird, um u.a. eindeutige und nicht-ratbare Session-Identifikatoren zu erzeugen. Ändern Sie diesen Wert in etwas hart zu erratendes, sofern Sie nicht mit dem bereits zufällig erzeugten Wert zufrieden sind.

str.o: The minimum allowed bitrate, in bits/second. If the client is slower than this set bitrate, it will be disconnected (after a timeout). Setting this higher than 14000 is not recommended if you have modem users.
str.t: Die minimal erlaubte Bitrate, in Bits/Sekunde. Wenn der Browser langsamer ist als diese Rate, wird seine Verbindung nach einem Timeout gelöst. Bei Modem-Benutzern ist es nicht empfohlen, diesen Wert auf 14000 oder höher zu setzen.

changed.from: Clear query

The syntax is:
userdb userdatabase module
Select a non-default userdatabase module. The default is to search all modules. The userdatabase module config_userdb is always present, and contains the configuration users
authmethod authentication module
Select a non-default authentication method.
realm realm name
The realm is used when user authentication info is requested
Below, CMD is one of 'allow' and 'deny'
CMD ip=ip/bits [return]
CMD ip=ip:mask [return]
CMD ip=pattern[,pattern,...] [return]
Match the remote IP-address.
CMD user=name[,name,...] [return]
Requires a authenticated user. If the user name 'any' is used, any valid user will be OK. Otherwise, one of the listed users are required.
CMD group=name[,name,...] [return]
Requires a authenticated user with a group. If the group name 'any' is used, any valid group will be OK. Otherwise, one of the listed groups are required.
CMD dns=pattern[,pattern,...] [return]
Require one of the specified DNS domain-names
CMD time=HH:mm-HH:mm [return]
Only allow access to the module from the first time to the second each day. Both times should be specified in 24-hour HH:mm format.
CMD day=day[,day,...] [return]
Only allow access during certain days. Day is either a numerical value (monday=1, sunday=7) or a string (monday, thuesday etc)

pattern is always a glob pattern (* = any characters, ? = any character).

return means that reaching this command results in immediate return, only useful for 'allow'.

'deny' always implies a return, no futher testing is done if a 'deny' match.

str.o:
The syntax is:
userdb userdatabase module
Select a non-default userdatabase module. The default is to search all modules. The userdatabase module config_userdb is always present, and contains the configuration users
authmethod authentication module
Select a non-default authentication method.
realm realm name
The realm is used when user authentication info is requested
Below, CMD is one of 'allow' and 'deny'
CMD ip=ip/bits [return]
CMD ip=ip:mask [return]
CMD ip=pattern[,pattern,...] [return]
Match the remote IP-address.
CMD user=name[,name,...] [return]
Requires an authenticated user. If the user name 'any' is used, any valid user will be OK; if the user name 'ANY' is used, a valid user is preferred, but not required. Otherwise, one of the listed users is required.
CMD group=name[,name,...] [return]
Requires an authenticated user with a group. If the group name 'any' is used, any valid group will be OK. Otherwise, one of the listed groups are required.
CMD dns=pattern[,pattern,...] [return]
Require one of the specified DNS domain-names
CMD time=HH:mm-HH:mm [return]
Only allow access to the module from the first time to the second each day. Both times should be specified in 24-hour HH:mm format.
CMD day=day[,day,...] [return]
Only allow access during certain days. Day is either a numerical value (Monday=1, Sunday=7) or a string (monday, tuesday etc)

pattern is always a glob pattern (* = any characters, ? = any character).

return means that reaching this command results in immediate return, only useful for 'allow'.

'deny' always implies a return, no futher testing is done if a 'deny' match.
str.t:
Die Syntax ist:
userdb userdatabase module
Wählt ein bestimmtes userdatabase-Modul aus. Das Standardverhalten ist, sämtliche Module zu durchsuchen. Das userdatabase-Modul des Konfigurations-Interfaces ist immer präsent und enthält die Benutzer des Konfigurations-Interfaces
authmethod authentication module
Wählt eine bestimmte Authentikations-Methode.
realm realm name
Der Realm, der bei einer Benutzer-Authentikation verwendet wird
Im Folgenden ist CMD entweder 'allow' oder 'deny'
CMD ip=ip/bits [return]
CMD ip=ip:mask [return]
CMD ip=pattern[,pattern,...] [return]
Überprüfung auf IP-Adresse des Webbrowsers.
CMD user=name[,name,...] [return]
Ein Benutzer wird verlangt. Wird 'any' benutzt, ist jeder Benutzer berechtigt. Ansonsten ist einer der gelisteten Benutzernamen notwendig.
CMD group=name[,name,...] [return]
Eine Benutzergruppe wird verlangt. Wird 'any' benutzt, ist jede Gruppe berechtigt. Ansonsten ist eine der gelisteten Benutzergruppen notwendig.
CMD dns=pattern[,pattern,...] [return]
Einer der angegebenen DNS Domainnamen ist erforderlich
CMD time=HH:mm-HH:mm [return]
Nur Zugriffe innerhalb des angegebenen Zeitintervalls sind zulässig. Beide Zeiten sollten im 24-Stunden Format HH:mm angegeben werden.
CMD day=day[,day,...] [return]
Nur Zugriffe an bestimmten Tagen sind zulässig. Der Tag wird als Zahl (Montag=1, Sonntag=7) angegeben.

pattern ist immer ein Muster (* = jede Zeichenkette, ? = jedes einzelne Zeichen).

return bedeutet, daß bei diesem Kommando sofort das Ergebnis zurückgegeben wird. Dies ist nur sinnvoll bei 'allow'..

'deny' bedeutet immer ein sofortige Rückgabe, kein weiteren Überprüfungen finden statt.

changed.from:
The compatibility level is used by different modules to select the right behavior to remain compatible with earlier Roxen versions. When a server configuration is created, this variable is set to the current version. After that it's never changed automatically, thereby ensuring that server configurations migrated from earlier Roxen versions is kept at the right compatibility level.

This variable may be changed manually, but it's advisable to test the site carefully afterwards. A reload of the whole server configuration is required to propagate the change properly to all modules.

Available compatibility levels:
2.1   Corresponds to Roxen WebServer 2.1.
2.2   Corresponds to Roxen WebServer 2.2.
2.4   Corresponds to Roxen WebServer 2.4. This version is also commonly known as 3.2 - the version number that applies to the release of Roxen CMS which contains Roxen WebServer 2.4.
2.5   Corresponds to no released version. This compatibility level is only used to turn on some optimizations that have compatibility issues with 2.4, notably the optimization of cache static tags in the <cache> tag.

str.o:
The compatibility level is used by different modules to select the right behavior to remain compatible with earlier Roxen versions. When a server configuration is created, this variable is set to the current version. After that it's never changed automatically, thereby ensuring that server configurations migrated from earlier Roxen versions is kept at the right compatibility level.

This variable may be changed manually, but it's advisable to test the site carefully afterwards. A reload of the whole server configuration is required to propagate the change properly to all modules.

Compatibility level notes:

  • 2.4 also applies to the version commonly known as 3.2. That was the release of Roxen CMS which contained Roxen WebServer 2.4.
  • 2.5 corresponds to no released version. This compatibility level is only used to turn on some optimizations that have compatibility issues with 2.4, notably the optimization of cache static tags in the <cache> tag.
  • There are no compatibility differences between 5.0 and 5.1, so those two compatibility levels can be used interchangeably.
str.t:
Der Kompatibilitäts-Level wird von einigen Modulen benutzt, um das korrekte Verhalten zu wählen, um mit früheren Roxen-Version kompatibel zu bleiben. Wenn eine Server-Konfiguration erstellt wird, wird diese Variable auf die aktuelle Version gesetzt. Danach wird sie niemals automatisch geändert, um zu gewährleisten, dass Server-Konfigurationen, die von früheren Roxen-Versionen migriert werden, auf dem richtigen Kompatibilitäts-Level zu halten.

Diese Variable kann manuell geändert werden, die Site sollte danach jedoch ausführlich getestet werden. Ein Neustart der gesamten Server-Konfiguration ist notwendig, um die Änderung ordentlich an alle Module mitzuteilen.

Verfügbare Kompatibilitäts-Level:
2.1   Entspricht Roxen WebServer 2.1.
2.2   Entspricht Roxen WebServer 2.2.
2.4   Entspricht Roxen WebServer 2.4. Diese Version ist auch als 3.2 bekannt - die Versionsnummer des Roxen CMS, die den Roxen WebServer 2.4 enthält.
2.5   Entspricht keiner veröffentlichten Version. Dieser Kompatibilitäts-Level wird nur für einige Optimierungen gegenüber der Version 2.4 benutzt, besonders der Optimierung des <cache>-Tags.

What to return when an authentication attempt failed.

Path to a program to compress log files, e.g. /usr/bin/bzip2 or /usr/bin/gzip. Note 1: The active log file is never compressed. Log rotation needs to be used using the "Log file" filename substitutions (e.g. $LOGDIR/mysite/Log.%y-%m-%d). Note 2: Compression is limited to scanning files with filename substitutions within a fixed directory (e.g. $LOGDIR/mysite/Log.%y-%m-%d, not $LOGDIR/mysite/%y/Log.%m-%d).
Enter a identifier that will be displayed in the head of config interface. This makes it easier to distinguish between different site configurations.
Logging: Dump threads by file polling

This option can be used to produce dumps of all the threads in the debug log in situations where the Administration Interface doesn't respond.

It works by checking for a file called "<config name>.dump_threads" in the same directory as the debug log. <config name> is the name of the server configuration, i.e. the same as the base name of the debug log files (typically "default"). If this file exists, a thread dump is generated and the file is deleted. If a file on the form "<config name>.dump_threads.<n>", where <n> is an integer, exists then n thread dumps are generated in one minute intervals.

Note that this method normally isn't necessary in unix-like environments; there you can just send a SIGQUIT signal to the pike process to get a thread dump.

Enabling this creates a dedicated thread.
Internal data that cannot be shared between servers.
Internal data that may be shared between servers.

Whether to enable HTTP protocol compression. Many types of text content (HTML, CSS, JavaScript etc.) can be compressed quite a lot, so enabling HTTP compression may improve the visitors' perception of the site's performance. It's however a trade-off between server processing power and bandwidth. Requests that end up in the protocol cache will be served in the compressed form directly from the protocol cache, so for such requests the processing power overhead can be held relatively low.

The MIME types for which to enable compression. The forms "maintype/*" and "maintype/subtype" are allowed, but globbing on the general form (such as "maintype/*subtype" or "maintype/sub*") is not allowed and such globs will be silently ignored.
The minimum file size for which to enable compression. (It might not be worth it to compress a request if it can fit into a single TCP/IP packet anyways.)

The maximum file size for which to enable compression. Note that the general protocol cache entry size limit applies, so if the compression of dynamic requests is disabled, files larger than the protocol cache maximum file size setting will never be served compressed regardless of this setting.

The compression level to use (integer between 1 and 9). Higher number means more compression at the cost of processing power and vice versa. You may need to restart the server for this setting to take effect.

If enabled, even requests that aren't cacheable in the protocol cache will be compressed. If the site has many lightweight requests that are not protocol cacheable, the processing overhead may become relatively large with this setting turned on.
MIB suffix to 1.3.6.1.4.1.8614.1.1.2 identifying this site.

Check MySQL tables on server start, and automatically repair if necessary. Fast checks only tables that haven't been closed properly. Normal checks for general errors. Medium catches 99.99 % of all errors. Should be good enough for most cases. Extended checks the tables VERY throughly. Only use this in extreme cases as myisamchk should normally be able to find out if the table is OK even without this switch.
Logging: Dump threads for slow requests

This enables a monitor that dumps all the threads in the debug log whenever any request, background job or the backend thread has been running for more than a set number of seconds, which is configured with the "Slow request timeout" and "Slow backend timeout" settings.

This setting is a counter: A positive number stops the monitor after that many thread dumps have been made, -1 enables the monitor permanently, and zero disables it. Positive numbers aren't persistent, so will be reset to zero whenever the server is restarted.

Warning: If you set the timeout too low, combined with a high or no limit, then the debug log can fill up very quickly and the server become very slow due to the amount of logging. If that happens and it gets difficult to change back the value then you can force the monitor to be disabled from the start by adding the define "NO_SLOW_REQ_BT" (i.e. add "-DNO_SLOW_REQ_BT" to the start script or in the DEFINES environment variable).

Enabling this creates a dedicated thread.
The timeout in seconds for requests or background jobs to trig a thread dump. Zero disables monitoring of those. See the "Dump threads for slow requests" setting for details.

The timeout in seconds for the backend thread to trig a thread dump. Zero disables monitoring of it. See the "Dump threads for slow requests" setting for details.

The backend thread is a special thread that manages most I/O and directs the incoming requests to the handler threads. It should never be occupied for a significant amount of time since that would make the server essentially unresponsive. Therefore this timeout should be small.

Note that a good value for this is very dependent on hardware. The default setting here is conservative and probably should be lowered to be of real use.

Warning!
This might take a long time to complete.
The amount of time this takes depends on how large the tables are.
Note: This schedule is also used to schedule backups for Roxen's internal databases.
Are you sure you want to restore the default value?

Maximum size in MByte for all RAM caches taken together. This limit covers the caches visible in the Cache status page.

Note that there are many more things in the Roxen WebServer that take space, including some caches that are not handled by the common RAM cache. Also, there is various indirect memory overhead that is not directly accounted for by the size calculations. All these taken together means that the figure configured here cannot be mapped straightly to the size of the Roxen process as reported by the OS. The optimal setting here is the one that in general keeps the Roxen process at a size that avoids swapping and leaves enough memory for buffers and other processes that need to run at the same time (e.g. the Roxen instance of the MySQL server).

Interval in seconds between RAM cache garbage collector runs. This GC removes entries from the RAM caches that have timed out or are stale for other reasons, thereby making more room for new entries. The configured cache size limits are enforced when entries are added, so this GC is not required to keep the cache sizes down.

Running this GC too seldom causes some RAM caches to contain many invalid cache entries, which could push out valid cache entries. Running it too often causes unnecessary server load.
What to return if the server is too busy. See also "Handler queue timeout".

Requests that have been waiting this many seconds on the handler queue will not be processed. Instead, a 503 error code and the "Server too busy message" will be returned to the client. This may help the server to cut down the queue length after spikes of heavy load.
Use proxy for outgoing requests. E.g. when browsing external web sites through the Linkbrowser or when Insert cached-href fetches data from an external location.
The URL of the proxy to use for outgoing requests.
The directory the backup will be saved in. If you chose auto, Roxen will generate a directory name that includes the database name and today's date in <tt>$VARDIR/backup</tt> (%s).
Tip: Put '--' on a line to ignore everything below it.

The maximum priority value for modules.

In most cases the default (9) is fine, but in some configurations there may be more than 10 modules of the same type that would otherwise conflict with each other.

Note that existing module priorities will be scaled accordingly when this value is changed.
Socket paths and/or IP:ports to bind for log output from this configuration. $JSONLOGDIR will expand to <configuration directory>/_jsonlog where sockets should be reasonably secure.
Whether to require the AUTH TLS command (RFC4217) before login.
Cipher suite minimum effective key strength

The minimum number of effective bits to secure connections.

Common ciphers (subject to availability) in order of effective key bits as of December 2015:

24
Export RC4 (aka RC4-40)
32
Export DES (aka DES-40)
38
RC4
40
DES
112
3-DES (Note that this cipher is the minimum required cipher in many versions of TLS)
128
AES-128
Camellia-128
256
AES-256
Camellia-256
ChaCha20

Cipher strengths lower than 112 bits are NOT recommended, and there are RFCs that prohibit the use of all those suites.
Optional password to decrypt the SSL key file(s).

Selects an additional cipher suite policy.

The supported filter modes are:

Default
Use the default cipher suite selection policy, and allow all cipher suites that have sufficient strength.
Ephemeral key exchanges only
Only allow cipher suites that use a key exchange with ephemeral keys (aka "Perfect Forward Security"). Ie either ECDHE or DHE.
Suite B (relaxed)
Same as Default, but prefer the suites specified in Suite B.
Suite B (ephemeral only)
Same as Ephemeral key exchanges only, but prefer the suites specified in Suite B.
Suite B (transitional)
Support only the suites specified by RFCs 5430 and 6460.
Suite B (strict)
Support only the suites specified by RFC 6460.

Note: Full Suite B operation is not supported in all configurations.

Note: For full Suite B compliance a suitable certificate must also be used.

Reject clients that want to use a version of SSL/TLS lower than the selected version.

Note: SSL 3.0 has been deprecated in RFC 7568.
Auto Maintenance: Enable Automatic Patch import
Automatically fetch and import patches to the server from www.roxen.com.
Auto Maintenance: Restart and apply patches
Apply any pending imported patches when the server is automatically restarted.
Show the status for the filesystem garbage collectors.

<rect x='%d' y='%d' width='10' height='%d' style='fill:%s;'> <title>%s: %s - %s %f% (%d)</title> </rect> <rect x='%d' y='0' width='10' height='%d' style='fill:%s;'> <title>%s: %s - %s %f% (%d)</title> </rect>
Not a member of any backup schedule.
%d is the highest priority and 0 the lowest.

This module provides a REST API for parts of the Administration Interface.

The API is JSON based - i.e. responses are JSON encoded and PUT/POST data is expected to be JSON encoded too.

In general, the following request methods are available:

  • GET: Query the current value of a resource.
  • PUT: Update the current value of a resource.
  • POST: Add a resource.
  • DELETE: Remove a resource.

The "X-Roxen-API" header must be set in all API requests. This requirement acts as a minimum counter-measure against CSRF attacks.

The resource specifier "_all" can be used to map an operation over all resources (see examples below).

Examples: 

  • GET /rest/variables/
    - list global variables
  • GET /rest/configurations/
    - list configurations
  • GET /rest/configurations/CMS/
    - get configuration "CMS" (currently not supported)
  • GET /rest/configurations/CMS/?envelope=1
    - get configuration "CMS" in envelope. Provides a list of available subresources, such as "modules". 
  • GET /rest/configurations/CMS/modules/
    - list enabled modules in the configuration "CMS".
  • GET /rest/configurations/CMS/modules/
    - list enabled modules in the configuration "CMS".
  • GET /rest/configurations/CMS/modules/yui/variables/mountpoint
    - get the value of the variable "mountpoint" in the "yui" module.
  • PUT /rest/variables/abs_timeout
    - change the value of the "abs_timeout" global variable. The data body of the PUT request should be the JSON encoded value to set.
  • POST /rest/configurations/CMS/modules/yui/
    - add an instance of the YUI module to the configuration "CMS".
  • DELETE /rest/configurations/CMS/modules/yui!0/
    - remove instance #0 of the YUI module in the configuration "CMS".
  • PUT /rest/configurations/CMS/modules/yui!0/actions/Reload
    - Reload the YUI module.
  • PUT /rest/configurations/CMS/modules/insite_editor!0/actions/Clear Persistent Cache
    - call action button "Clear Persistent Cache " in the Insite Editor module.
  • PUT /rest/configurations/_all/modules/insite_editor!0/actions/Clear Persistent Cache
    - call action button "Clear Persistent Cache " in the Insite Editor module in all configurations.
  • GET /rest/configurations/_all/modules/_all/variables/mountpoint
    - get the value of the "mountpoint" variable in all modules across all configurations.

cURL example: 

curl -H "X-Roxen-API: 1" -u admin:password https://localhost.roxen.com:22202/rest/variables/
Where the REST API is mounted.

The TLS certificate(s) to use.

Certificate and key files matching the Global Variables/Settings/Certificate and Private Key Globs setting are automatically imported and valid combinations are listed above.

At least one certificate must be selected.

The Server Name Indication (SNI) extension sent by the TLS client will be used to choose a specific certificate for the connection from the set selected here.

This is a list of globs for which corresponding files will automatically be imported into the certificate database on server start.

It may be left empty, in which case any certificates to use will need to be added by hand.
The table is not included in backups of this database.
